data.title: Rich in Color – Reading & Reviewing Diverse YA Books
data.text:
Title: The Blonde Dies First Author: Joelle Wellington Genres: Thriller/Horror Pages: 336 Publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers Review Copy: ARC by publisher Availability: Available now Summary: A group of friends fight to choose their own fates in […] Read More

I thought it would be fun to highlight some books that came out earlier this summer! Have you read any of these yet? Did they make your TBR list? Looking for Smoke by K.A. Cobell Heartdrum Since moving to the […] Read More

Twin Flames by Olivia Abtahi Summary: On estranged twins Leila and Bianca’s eighteenth birthday, Leila suddenly gains a djinn’s superpowers, and the twins realize that their town can only survive the djinns’ secret plans if they learn to work together […] Read More

Our next group discussion is coming up next month with the New York Times Bestseller This Ravenous Fate by Hayley Dennings. Described as a vengeful Black lesbian vampire book set during the Harlem Renaissance, this book is one that we […] Read More

I’m a big fan of the Olympics and have absolutely let responsibilities go in favor of watching amazing sport. And I thought, as the Olympics come to a close that I’d share some books that focus on athletes aiming to […] Read More

We found quite a few books being released this week and they seem to be full to the brim with magic and supernatural activity. Ami (Guardians of Dawn #2) by S. Jae-Jones Wednesday Books When the Pillar blooms, the end […] Read More
